com.siperian.sif.message.hm

Class GetOneHopRequest

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.siperian.sif.message.SiperianRequest
      • com.siperian.sif.message.hm.GetOneHopRequest
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    public class GetOneHopRequest
extends SiperianRequest
    Fetch one level of Relationships and related Entities for the Entities specified in the request. This request is used to get Entities that are directly related to the Entities in the request. OneHopFilter, record states, and filter criteria can be used to filter Relationships and Entities that are returned in the GetOneHopResponse.

    Required Parameters:

    • setHmConfigurationUid(String) - UID of the HM Configuration.
    • setEntityKeys(ArrayList) - List of SiperianObjectRecordKey objects identifying Entities for which Relationships and Entities are needed.
    Optional Parameters:

    • Effective Date - the date used to retrieve an effective period of the HM relationships entity and objects. If this parameter is present the result will be the result of BVT calculation for the specified effective period.

    Usage Example:

    The following example shows how to fetch employees who work at companies with ROWID_OBJECT values "123" and "456". 

     
 GetOneHopRequest request = new GetOneHopRequest();
 request.setHmConfigurationUid("HM_CONFIGURATION.Default|Master");
 
 ArrayList keys = new ArrayList();
 SiperianObjectRecordKey key = new SiperianObjectRecordKey();
 key.setRecordKey(RecordKey.rowid("123"));
 key.setSiperianObjectUid("HM_ENTITY_TYPE.Company");
 keys.add(key);
 
 key = new SiperianObjectRecordKey();
 key.setRecordKey(RecordKey.rowid("456"));
 key.setSiperianObjectUid("HM_ENTITY_TYPE.Company");
 keys.add(key);
 
 request.setEntityKeys(keys);
 
 OneHopFilter filter = new OneHopFilter();
 filter.setActiveRelsOnly(true); // Only get current employees
 
 ArrayList relTypes = new ArrayList();
 relTypes.add("HM_RELATIONSHIP_TYPE.WorksFor");
 filter.setRelTypes(relTypes);
 
 request.setOneHopFilter(filter);
 request.setDisablePaging(true);
 
 GetOneHopResponse response =  (GetOneHopResponse) siperianClient.process(request);
 
 // Get the records returned and split them into lists
 // of Entities and Relationships.
 List recs = response.getRecords();
 List entities = new ArrayList();
 List relationships = new ArrayList();

 for (int index = 0; index < recs.size(); index++) {
      Record rec = (Record) recs.get(index);
      String uid = rec.getSiperianObjectUid();
      if (uid.startsWith("HM_RELATIONSHIP_TYPE.")) {
          relationships.add(rec);
      } else if (uid.startsWith("HM_ENTITY_TYPE.") {
          entities.add(rec);
      } else {
          log.error("Invalid UID : " + uid);
  }
 }

    See Also:
    GetOneHopResponse, OneHopFilter, SiperianObjectRecordKey, HubStateIndicator, SiperianRequest, Serialized Form

    API Pair: GetOneHopResponse

    API Group: Data Retrieval

      • setDisablePaging

        public void setDisablePaging(boolean disablePaging)
        Set this flag to true to disable paging so the Hub Server does not store the search results. Paging is enabled by default. Disabling paging can improve performance.

        For more information about retrieving subsequent pages, see GetSearchResultsRequest.

        Parameters:
        disablePaging - If true, paging is disabled for this request.

        public List getEntityKeys()
        See corresponding setter method for details.

        An empty List if the corresponding setter method has not been called.

      • setEntityKeys

        public void setEntityKeys(ArrayList entityKeys)
        Set the SiperianObjectRecordKey objects for Entities. These are the Entities for which associated Relationships and Entities are needed.

        The ArrayList must not be empty or null.

        Parameters:
        entityKeys - ArrayList of SiperianObjectRecordKey objects for the starting Entities.

      • setHmConfigurationUid

        public void setHmConfigurationUid(String hmConfigurationUid)
        Set the HM Configuration to be used for the request.

        The HM Configuration UID has the format HM_CONFIGURATION.<Profile>|<Sandbox>. For example: HM_CONFIGURATION.Default|Master.

        Parameters:
        hmConfigurationUid - HM Configuration UID used for processing the request.

        public OneHopFilter getOneHopFilter()
        See corresponding setter method for details.
        Returns:
        Null if the corresponding setter method has not been called.

      • setOneHopFilter

        public void setOneHopFilter(OneHopFilter oneHopFilter)
        Set OneHopFilter to filter Relationships and associated Entities that are returned.

        If no filter is specified the Hub Server returns all the active records. Call this method with a null value to clear the filter after it has been set. For more information about filtering, see OneHopFilter.

        Parameters:
        oneHopFilter - For filtering the results. Specify null (default) if no filter is needed.

      • getRecordsToReturn

        public int getRecordsToReturn()
        See corresponding setter method for details.
        Returns:
        0 if the corresponding setter method has not been called.

      • setRecordsToReturn

        public void setRecordsToReturn(int recordsToReturn)
        Set the maximum number of Relationship records to be returned.

        If this number is not specified or if the number is less than 1 or higher than the default value for the ORS, the default value for the ORS is used. The default value for the ORS is stored in GETLIST_LIMIT column of CMX_SYSTEM.C_REPOS_DATABASE table.

        Parameters:
        recordsToReturn - Maximum number of Relationship records to be returned.

      • getFilterCriteria

        public String getFilterCriteria()
        Deprecated. - will no longer be supported in 10.0, possibly earlier in 9.1
        See corresponding setter method for details.
        Returns:
        Null if the corresponding setter method has not been called.

      • setFilterCriteria

        public void setFilterCriteria(String filterCriteria)
        Deprecated. - will no longer be supported in 10.0, possibly earlier in 9.1
        Set the optional SQL WHERE clause used to filter the related Entities.

        The columns used in the WHERE clause must be in the Display Package for the Entity Types that are related to the Entities specified in the EntityKeys. The filter criteria corresponds to "Search Related Entities" functionality in Hierarchy Manager tool in the Hub Console.

        For example, say you have Entity Types "Company" and "Employee" that are related by one or more Relationship Types. If you call GetOneHopRequest without any filter criteria you might retrieve too many employees in the GetOneHopResponse. The filter criteria can be used to reduce that number by using some employee attributes. In this case, you could limit the results to only those employees who earn more than $100,000 and live in New York by specifying the filter criteria "SALARY > 100000 and STATE = 'NY'". The SALARY and STATE columns must be in the Display Package used by the "Employee" Entity Type in HM Configuration.

        Parameters:
        filterCriteria - SQL WHERE clause used to filter records. Set it to null (default) if no filter is needed.

      • getRecordStates

        public ArrayList getRecordStates()
        See corresponding setter method for details.
        Returns:
        An empty ArrayList if the corresponding setter method has not been called.

      • setRecordStates

        public void setRecordStates(ArrayList recordStates)
        Set the record states (HubStateIndicator objects) to filter Entities / Relationships that are returned in the GetOneHopResponse.

        Only Entities and Relationships with the states specified in the ArrayList are returned. If the ArrayList is empty (default), only the HubStateIndicator.ACTIVE records are returned.

        This method should only be called if State Management is enabled for all Entity and Relationship Base Objects used in the HM Configuration.

        Parameters:
        recordStates - ArrayList of HubStateIndicator objects. ArrayList can be empty but not null.

      • getRecordState

        public HubStateIndicator getRecordState(int i)
        See corresponding setter method for details.

        Parameters: The index used to get HubStateIndicator object from the ArrayList returned by getRecordStates(). The index must be less than getRecordStates().size().

        Returns:
        The HubStateIndicator object at the specified index in the ArrayList.
